elements.html:
Peano Axioms Which of the following are axioms of Peano arithmetics (including those for addition and multiplication, and instances of axiom schemata)?
∃𝑥.𝑥=𝑆(0)
¬(∃𝑥.0=𝑆(𝑥))
∀𝑥.𝑥+0=𝑥
∀𝑥.𝑥⋅𝑆(0)=𝑥
(0=0)∧(∀𝑥.(𝑥=0)⇒(𝑆(𝑥)=0))⇒(∀𝑥.𝑥=0)
∀𝑥,𝑦.𝑥⋅𝑆(𝑦)=𝑆(𝑥⋅𝑦)

Equivalence Relations Complete the definition (in all lower-case letters): A binary relation ∼⊆𝐴×𝐴 is called
•
reflexive, iff ∀𝑥.𝑥∼𝑥 ,
•
symmetric, iff ∀𝑥,𝑦.𝑥∼𝑦⇒𝑦∼𝑥 ,
•
transitive, iff ∀𝑥,𝑦,𝑧.𝑥∼𝑦∧𝑦∼𝑧⇒𝑥∼𝑧 .
A relation that is all three is called a equivalence relation.

Consider the set-theoretic definitions of the integers (on the basis of the natural numbers 𝜔 ) and the rationals. Which of the following is true?
Every integer is a pair of natural numbers
Every integer is a pair
Every rational number is a pair of integers
Every rational number is a pair
Every natural number is also an integer
Every integer is also a rational number
